intro: Onosma bourgaei, commonly known as the Bourgae's fleur-de-lis, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue to violet flowers in clusters, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Onosma bourgaei is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
